"Outgoing documents" component
When executing a business process, tasks assigned to users may require not only filling in the task profile fields but also preparing (drafting, generating, attaching) the required files in office or specialized formats. The appearance of a file during task processing implies linking (attaching) the file to the corresponding task.
Possible solutions
In automation projects, two fundamentally different approaches are typically used in such scenarios:
Option 1. Linking to a file
The file is placed on an external network resource, and a link to it is registered in the System.
This option is strongly discouraged in advanced automation practice, since the System does not control document availability or file attributes. There is a risk of uncontrolled and unmonitored content deletion, damage, or loss of critical information. Such solutions cannot guarantee data integrity.
Option 2. Attaching a file to the task
In this case, the file itself is uploaded and registered in the System.
To implement this option in
"WF. Process task"
[WF_PROCESS_TASK] business process tasks, a special
"Outgoing documents"
attribute ("Custom" type) is provided as a configurable software component. This attribute is considered a system (custom) attribute and supports custom actions with files.
By default, the used task visual is a system object ("Visual" [SYS_VISUAL]) and cannot be modified or reconfigured.
If visual customization is required, a user visual (a copy of the system one) should be created.
Visual
To enable the "Outgoing documents" custom attribute, create a user visual for the task and configure the attribute.
Then, by clicking the "Edit object" button, the visual opens in edit mode in a new tab, where key file management actions can be assigned to the "Outgoing documents" attribute.
Attribute setup
To configure the attribute, the user needs to define available options. For example, when enabling the actions:
show file upload button – to upload outgoing files from the user’s device;
show file delete button – to delete outgoing files from the registry;
allow adding files from the system – to add outgoing files previously uploaded to the System;
always show file control buttons – for static display of file control buttons.
If the "Always show file control buttons" option is disabled, available file control buttons appear when hovering over the field or hierarchy node.
As a result of the configuration, the "Outgoing documents" attribute becomes fully functional and takes the form of a software component as follows:

The set of available actions depends on access permissions.
